flawed_nl_solution:
There are 60 students because 8 x 15 = <<8*15=60>>60
60% of the lunchroom is boys because 100 - 40 = <<100-40=60>>60
There are 63 boys because 60 x .{percent_boys/percent_total} = <<60*.{percent_boys/percent_total}=63>>63
There are 24 girls because 60 x .{percent_girls/percent_total} = <<60*.{percent_girls/percent_total}=24>>24
The boys drink 63 cartons of milk because 63 x 1 = <<63*1=63>>63
The girls drink 48 cartons of milk because 24 x 2 = <<24*2=48>>48
They drink 111 cartons of milk because 63 + 48 = <<63+48=111>>111

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 36.0, not 63.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
